dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Meet the Stock Warren Buffett Has the Utmost Confidence In -- He's Been a Buyer for 24 of the Last 25 Quarters
News Content: When Berkshire Hathaway(NYSE: BRK.A)(NYSE: BRK.B) CEO Warren Buffett speaks, investors wisely pay attention. That's because the appropriately dubbed "Oracle of Omaha" has overseen a cumulative return in his company's Class A shares (BRK.A) of more than 5,570,000% spanning six decades.

Buffett's keys to success are no secret. Whether it's in his annual letter to shareholders or during the question-and-answer session at Berkshire's annual meeting, he lays out his game plan to for building wealth on Wall Street and keeping emotions in check. Berkshire's chief is a value-oriented, long-term investor who primarily focuses on businesses with sustainable competitive advantages and strong management teams.

But when overseeing a 44-stock, $296 billion investment portfolio, it can be tough to tell which, if any, stocks the Oracle of Omaha has the most confidence in.Berkshire Hathaway CEO Warren Buffett. Image source: The Motley Fool.

Apple, AmEx, and Bank of America are large holdings -- but none are Buffett's favorite stock

Logic would dictate that the three largest holdings by market value in Berkshire Hathaway's investment portfolio are the company's Warren Buffett has the utmost confidence in... but this isn't necessarily the case.

Tech giant Apple(NASDAQ: AAPL) has consistently been Berkshire's top holding for years, and remains a company Buffett speaks highly about. Aside from the iPhone being the market share-leading smartphone in the U.S., Apple's capital-return program is world-leading. More than $725 billion worth of the company's stock has been repurchased since the start of 2013, which has demonstrably improved its earnings per share (EPS).

However, Buffett and his top advisors, Todd Combs and Ted Weschler, have also overseen the sale of more than 615 million shares of Apple stock between Oct. 1, 2023 and Sept. 30, 2024. Even if this selling is purely for tax purposes, it likely rules out Apple as the stock Buffett has the most confidence in.

Credit-services provider American Express(NYSE: AXP) has worked its way up to No. 2 spot in Berkshire Hathaway's portfolio. "AmEx," as American Express is more commonly known, was labeled an "indefinite" holding in Buffett's letter to shareholders last year. Berkshire's investment team likely appreciate AmEx's ability to play both sides of the transaction counter, with the company generating payment processing fees from merchants, as well as annual fees and interest income from cardholders.

Yet it's been a long time since Buffett purchased shares of American Express. If this were truly Buffett's favorite company, he would likely add to the position.

Story Continues

Berkshire Hathaway's third-largest holding, Bank of America(NYSE: BAC), is a similar story to Apple. It's a company whose management team has received praise in the past from Buffett. BofA is the most interest-sensitive of America's money-center banks and it benefited immensely from the Federal Reserve's aggressive rate-hiking cycle from March 2022 through July 2023.

But since July 17, 2024, required Form 4 filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) show that Berkshire's top investment minds (led by Buffett) have sold 26% (about 266.5 million shares) of their Bank of America stake.Image source: Getty Images.

The Oracle of Omaha has purchased this stock in 24 out of the last 25 quarters

Interestingly enough, the stock Warren Buffett appears to have the utmost confidence in is a company that doesn't show up in Berkshire's quarterly filed Form 13Fs with the SEC. This is the form investors use to track the purchase and selling activity at Buffett's company.

Rather, detailed purchasing activity of this "favorite stock" can be found in Berkshire Hathaway's quarterly operating results. On the page prior to the beginning of the executive certifications, investors will find a breakdown of how many shares of Berkshire Hathaway Class A and B (BRK.B) stock the Oracle of Omaha purchased during the quarter. Perhaps it's fitting that the stock Buffett buys most and has the utmost confidence in is shares of his own company.

However, buying shares of Berkshire Hathaway stock hasn't always been easy for Warren Buffett. Prior to July 2018, shares could only be repurchased if Berkshire's stock fell to or below 120% of book value. Unfortunately (for Buffett), this is a threshold Berkshire Hathaway's stock never dipped to or below, which led to no buyback activity.

On July 17, 2018, Berkshire's board reworked the rules governing buybacks to give its CEO more freedom to buy shares of the company he's clearly the most confident in. Under the new criteria, share repurchases have no end date or cap as long as Berkshire has at least $30 billion in combined cash, cash equivalents, and U.S. Treasuries, and Buffett views his company's stock as intrinsically cheap. This last part is intentionally vague and allows Buffett to deploy his company's capital toward buybacks as he sees fit.

Even though Buffett didn't repurchase shares of his company's stock in the September-ended quarter, he had done so in each of the previous 24 quarters, with a cumulative $78 billion spent on buybacks.

Aside from these repurchases reinforcing Buffett's belief that Berkshire Hathaway is ideally positioned to take advantage of lengthy periods of economic expansion, these buybacks serve two additional purposes.

For one, steadily reducing the company's outstanding share count is incrementally increasing the ownership stakes of Berkshire's investors. This goes a long way to incentivizing the long-term ethos that Buffett's late right-hand man, Charlie Munger, helped to instill.

The other purpose behind these buybacks is to make Berkshire's stock more fundamentally attractive. Companies with steady or growing net income and a declining outstanding share count can expect their EPS to increase over time.

With Berkshire Hathaway closing out the third quarter with a record $325.2 billion in (combined) cash, cash equivalents, and U.S. Treasuries on its balance sheet, it seems only logical to expect Buffett to buy shares of the stock nearest and dearest to his heart in 2025.

Don’t miss this second chance at a potentially lucrative opportunity

Ever feel like you missed the boat in buying the most successful stocks? Then you’ll want to hear this.

On rare occasions, our expert team of analysts issues a “Double Down” stock recommendation for companies that they think are about to pop. If you’re worried you’ve already missed your chance to invest, now is the best time to buy before it’s too late. And the numbers speak for themselves:

Nvidia:if you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2009,you’d have $369,816!* Apple: if you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2008, you’d have $42,191!* Netflix: if you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2004, you’d have $527,206!*

Right now, we’re issuing “Double Down” alerts for three incredible companies, and there may not be another chance like this anytime soon.

Learn more »

*Stock Advisor returns as of January 21, 2025

Bank of America and American Express are advertising partners of Motley Fool Money. Sean Williams has positions in Bank of America. The Motley Fool has positions in and recommends Apple, Bank of America, and Berkshire Hathaway. The Motley Fool has a disclosure policy.

Meet the Stock Warren Buffett Has the Utmost Confidence In -- He's Been a Buyer for 24 of the Last 25 Quarters was originally published by The Motley Fool

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news highlights Warren Buffett's long-term confidence in Apple Inc. (AAPL) as a top holding despite recent sell-offs. While some shares have been sold for potential tax reasons, Buffett's historical purchasing patterns and Apple's strong fundamentals, including a leading market position and substantial capital-return program, suggest investor confidence is maintained. Buffett's mention in the headline adds credibility to the stock's value. Therefore, there is a higher probability that AAPL's stock price will rise due to sustained confidence from a notable investor, although some cautious sentiments may arise from the recent selling activity.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The article focuses on Warren Buffett's confidence in Berkshire Hathaway, not directly on Apple. While it mentions Apple is a large holding and Buffett speaks highly of it, it also highlights Berkshire's sale of a significant portion of Apple shares. This implies some uncertainty about Apple's future, or at least a shift in Berkshire's strategy regarding AAPL. The advertisement for a "Double Down" opportunity on potentially lucrative stocks seems like an attempt to piggy-back on Buffett's name & reputation. Overall, This isn't directly negative for Apple, but it doesn't provide a strong positive signal either. It's a mixed bag, slightly leaning towards neutral. Given these mixed signals, a minor upward movement is expected, but with tempered anticipation of a major increase.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.53, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.47, Reasoning: The news focuses on Warren Buffett's consistent buying of Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A, BRK.B) shares over the past 24 out of 25 quarters.  While the article mentions Apple as a significant holding, the recent selling of Apple shares by Berkshire Hathaway contradicts the idea that it's Buffett's most confident holding.  The news emphasizes Buffett's confidence in Berkshire Hathaway itself, driven by factors like its strong cash position and buyback program.  Therefore, the news is expected to have a limited direct impact on Apple's stock price. Any movement in AAPL is more likely to be influenced by broader market trends and Apple's own financial performance rather than this specific news about Buffett's preference for Berkshire Hathaway. We assume a slightly higher probability of a price rise due to the general positive sentiment surrounding Buffett's investment strategies, but this impact is expected to be minimal.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news highlights Warren Buffett's confidence in Apple Inc. (AAPL) as a key holding in Berkshire Hathaway's portfolio, despite some recent sales. The article emphasizes Apple's strong market position, sustainable competitive advantages, and a world-leading capital-return program, including significant stock repurchases. While there have been some sales of Apple shares, the overall tone of the article is positive, noting Buffett's high regard for the company. This positive sentiment, combined with Apple's robust financials and market dominance, suggests a higher probability of a stock price rise.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: -1, Prediction of stock price falling: -1, Reasoning: Fail to give a prediction. Error Reason: Parse error
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article discusses Warren Buffett's investment strategy and his confidence in certain stocks. Although the article mentions Apple, American Express, and Bank of America as large holdings in Berkshire Hathaway's portfolio, it suggests that Buffett's actions, such as selling shares of these companies, indicate he may not have the utmost confidence in them. Instead, the article highlights that Buffett has been consistently buying shares of his own company, Berkshire Hathaway, in 24 out of the last 25 quarters, demonstrating his confidence in the company's potential. This information is expected to positively impact the stock price of Berkshire Hathaway. However, since the question is about Apple (AAPL), we must consider how this news affects Apple. The article does mention Apple as a significant holding but also notes that Buffett has sold a substantial number of Apple shares, which could be perceived as a lack of confidence or simply a strategic move. Given this context, the news may have a slightly negative impact on Apple's stock price due to the sold shares, but the overall effect of Buffett's endorsement and the general positive outlook on long-term investments could counterbalance this.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The financial news highlights that Warren Buffett and his advisors appear to have the utmost confidence in Berkshire Hathaway stock itself, as evidenced by their continuous stock purchases over the years. This level of commitment from Buffett is seen positively as an endorsement of the company's long-term prospects. However, the news does not directly mention immediate impacts on the stock performance but rather focuses on past trends and strategies. Considering Buffett's history and reputation, the market might react positively to this reaffirmation of confidence.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news highlights Warren Buffett's long-term confidence in Apple as a key holding in Berkshire Hathaway's portfolio, even though there have been notable sales of Apple shares recently. This dual narrative creates a complex picture. On one hand, Buffett's history of purchasing Apple, coupled with its strong market position and substantial capital-return program, suggests sustained investor confidence. On the other hand, the recent sell-offs may introduce uncertainty regarding short-term sentiment. Given the mixed signals but overall positive tone attributed to Apple's strengths and Buffett's endorsement, there is a higher probability leaning towards a price rise than a fall. However, caution is warranted due to recent sales.

It mentions that Apple remains a top holding and Buffett speaks highly of it, but also highlights Berkshire's sale of a significant portion of AAPL shares. This implies some uncertainty about Apple or a strategic shift in Berkshire's holdings. Other models have given varying degrees of probabilities between rise/fall, ranging from 0.53/0.47 to 0.7/0.3. Considering the previous rounds, there doesn't seem to be a strong consensus. This round, I will slightly decrease my confidence level in AAPL potentially rising given the mixed bag of information and other's predictions.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.52, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.48, Reasoning: The news focuses on Warren Buffett's continued investment in Berkshire Hathaway, not Apple directly.  While Apple is a significant holding for Berkshire, the article highlights the sale of Apple shares. This mixed signal, coupled with the overall emphasis on Berkshire's buybacks, suggests a limited direct impact on AAPL's stock price.  Although Buffett's positive view of Apple is mentioned, the recent sales overshadow this to some degree. Previous predictions show a range of opinions, with some models leaning towards a price rise based on the general positive sentiment surrounding Buffett, while others are more neutral or even slightly negative given the share sales. Considering the ambiguity and the lack of a direct, strong positive endorsement for Apple,  I'm assigning a slightly higher probability to no significant movement, leaning towards a small increase due to the lingering positive association with Buffett.  The inherent uncertainty leads to a neutral outlook, but with a marginal bias toward a slight increase.

(AAPL). While Apple is mentioned as a significant holding, the article notes that Buffett and his advisors have sold a substantial number of Apple shares, which could be interpreted as a lack of confidence or a strategic move. Previous predictions also reflect a range of opinions, with some models leaning towards a neutral or slightly positive impact on Apple's stock price. Given this context, the impact on Apple's stock price is expected to be muted, with a slight bias towards a rise due to the general positive sentiment around Buffett's investment strategies, but this is balanced by the uncertainty introduced by the recent sales.

Therefore, I'm predicting probabilities closer to neutral, slightly favoring a price rise due to the continued association with Buffett's investment strategies, but acknowledging the uncertainty introduced by Berkshire's sales.

While Apple Inc. (AAPL) is mentioned as a significant holding in Berkshire's portfolio, the article also notes that Buffett and his advisors have sold a substantial number of Apple shares, which could be interpreted as a strategic shift or lack of confidence in the short term. The article does emphasize Apple's strong market position and capital-return program, but the recent sales introduce uncertainty. Given the mixed signals—Buffett's historical endorsement of Apple versus the recent sell-offs—the impact on Apple's stock price is likely to be neutral to slightly positive. The overall sentiment from previous predictions also reflects a range of opinions, with some leaning towards a slight rise due to Buffett's general positive reputation, while others are more cautious due to the sales. Considering these factors, the probability of a stock price rise is slightly higher than a fall, but the difference is marginal.

Considering the overall positive sentiment around Buffett's investment strategies and Apple's strong fundamentals, there is a slightly higher probability of the stock price rising. However, the recent selling activity and the focus of the news on Berkshire Hathaway rather than Apple temper this outlook.

While Apple is mentioned as a significant holding, the article also notes the recent sales of Apple shares by Berkshire Hathaway. Considering the mixed signals and the focus on Berkshire Hathaway, the probabilities of the stock price rising or falling are estimated based on the potential for the news to slightly increase investor confidence in Apple due to Buffett's endorsement, despite the sales of Apple shares. The overall analysis from various models indicates a range of opinions, from a slight bias towards a rise to a more neutral outlook. Given the information and the mixed sentiment, a moderate probability of a stock price rise is assigned, taking into account the general positive sentiment surrounding Buffett's investment strategies and the uncertainty introduced by the recent sales.

While Buffett's consistent purchasing of Berkshire Hathaway stock indicates his overall confidence in his own company's potential, the information specifically related to Apple is somewhat contradictory and lacks explicit statements about their long-term stance towards Apple. Given the recent selling activities, there's a mixed sentiment that might lead to cautious movements in investor expectations. Overall, the news presents a balanced view with a slight tilt towards caution or neutrality affecting Apple's stock.

Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
  "reasoning": "The news article presents a mixed narrative for Apple (AAPL). On one hand, it highlights Warren Buffett's long-standing positive view of Apple, its strong market position, and successful capital-return program. This suggests continued investor confidence. On the other hand, it emphasizes that Berkshire Hathaway has recently sold a significant number of Apple shares which raises uncertainty about short-term sentiment. The article, while mentioning Apple significantly, primarily focuses on Buffett's confidence in Berkshire Hathaway. Examining the trend of previous predictions, there's a shift towards a neutral or slightly negative outlook regarding Apple's stock. Considering the mixed signals, the recent sell-off outweighs the positive aspects, resulting in a near-neutral market expectation. Therefore, a slight upward bias because of Apple's overall strength is acknowledged, and somewhat neutralized by the contradictory evidence related to Berkshire Hathaway's recent activities.",
```
